rename.from: Incremental ~run on 0.13.6 with 2.6.6 can't 'obtain files to watch'
rename.to: Incremental ~run on 0.13.16 with 2.6.6 can't 'obtain files to watch'

body: I'm experiencing the same problems with `run`, where refreshing the webpage does not trigger an incremental compile. It works the few first minutes and then randomly after a while it stops detecting file changes.

I have the same problem as @Rovak , switching to polling seems to make it better, but it still just stops getting updates after some time (Triggers "Compilation Complete" but actually does not compile anything)

Same problem here.
On IntelliJ IDEA, the project doesn't even start.

issue.title: Avoid trying to watch non-existing files and directories

repository.name: playframework
repository.description: The Community Maintained High Velocity Web Framework For Java and Scala.

issue.body:
## Fixes

Fixes #7898.

## Purpose

Filter out non-existing files and directories from the list of watched files.

body:
Thank you guys for reporting the problem.

See #7907 for a fix.

@hayd, @arnbak, @Rovak, @Daxten and @Flo354.

Could you please try with version `2.7.0-2017-10-10-ad9e06d-SNAPSHOT`. It is a nightly build so you need to add the following resolver:

```scala
resolvers += "Sonatype OSS Snapshots" at "https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots"
```
If it works with this version, then we can consider this as fixed. If not, at least we should get a stack trace to better debug why reload is failing.
@marcospereira Works for me, thanks for the quick fix!

@marcospereira the issue still occurs when using `run`. I'm not sure if i should see the  `Error occurred obtaining files to watch.  Terminating continuous execution...` message during `run` or the trace when it stops triggering incremental compiles, i'm not seeing any messages or errors in the console or log files.
